result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr

records.addlTxt: Justice Point supervision modified to LEVEL 3. All other conditions remain.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 3.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has received a global offer and parties are continuing negotiations. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 36. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Cecilio Lugo in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Celio Lugo.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders 22CM1352 be transferred to Branch 13. Defendant was found competent in felony matter, 21CF3722, court adopts findings. Defendant is competent to proceed. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
by attorney Rosenthal

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo in court via Zoom with attorney Fred Richardson.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for further proceedings. Defense moves to withdraw due to a conflict of interest. Court grants motion. State Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed

22RM036274  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
07/06/2022
signed and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT, LEVEL 3 for supervision.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LBL and JDC.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cecilio Barrios Lugo appeared by video means.
Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report and INITIAL APPEARANCE. Parties do not contest the report. Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed. Court adopts Dr. Seipel's report.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Return on Doctor Report this date.  Attorney Richardson advises he will appear as a friend of the Court for the Initial Appearance and adjourned Return on Doctor's Report.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case rescheduled due to judge unavailability.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Judge Franke, Branch 25 due to judge unavailability.
Due to court congestion, matter is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency Report, 06/21/2022.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cecilio Barrios Lugo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge RICHARDS, Branch 30.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
